1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Sieve pattern.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Subtext.Sieve
6 ( -- * Module
7   module Koshucode.Baala.Subtext.Sieve.Token,
8   module Koshucode.Baala.Subtext.Sieve.Tree,
9
10   -- * Syntax
11   -- $Syntax
12 ) where
13
14import Koshucode.Baala.Subtext.Sieve.Token
15import Koshucode.Baala.Subtext.Sieve.Tree
16
17-- $Syntax
18--
19-- == Top
20--
21-- === T1. " /Text/ "
22--
23--  Literal /Text/.
24--
25--  >>> sivMatch "foo" `mapM` [ "foo", "bar", "baz" ]
26--  Right [True,False,False]
27--
28-- === T2. " /Text/ ( /Expr/ ) /Text/ "
29--
30--  Literal /Text/, pattern /Expr/, and literal /Text/.
31--  Outside of parens include brackets or braces
32--  are treated as literal text.
33--
34--  >>> sivMatch "ba( _ )" `mapM` [ "foo", "bar", "baz" ]
35--  Right [False,True,True]
36--
37-- === T3. " /Text/ &#x5B; /Expr/ &#x5D; /Text/ "
38--
39--  Optional /Expr/, i.e., single or no /Expr/.
40--
41--  >>> sivMatch "foo[ bar ]" `mapM` [ "foo", "foobar", "foobaz" ]
42--  Right [True,True,False]
43--
44-- === T4. " /Text/ { /Expr/ } /Text/ "
45--
46--  Repeat /Expr/ zero-or-more times.
47--
48--  >>> sivMatch "f{ o }bar" `mapM` [ "foo", "fbar", "fobar", "foobar" ]
49--  Right [False,True,True,True]
50--
51-- === T5. " /Text/ {- /Expr/ -} /Text/ "
52--
53--  Repeat /Expr/ one-or-more times.
54--
55--  >>> sivMatch "f{- o -}bar" `mapM` [ "foo", "fbar", "fobar", "foobar" ]
56--  Right [False,False,True,True]
57--
58-- === T6. " /Text/ {= ( /Times/ ) /Expr/ =} /Text/ "
59--
60--  Repeat /Expr/ in /Times/.
61--
62--  * __/Num-1/ - /Num-2/__ indicates lower-and-upper bounded repetition.
63--  * __/Num/ -__ indicates lower bounded repetition.
64--  * __- /Num/__ indicates upper bounded repetition.
65--  * __/Num/ ...__ indicates /Num/-times repetition.
66--
67--
68-- == Expr
69--
70-- === E1. _
71--
72--  Underscore indicates single any character.
73--
74--  >>> sivMatch "foo.( _ )" `mapM` [ "foo.k", "foo.hs", "foo.zip" ]
75--  Right [True,False,False]
76--
77-- === E2. *
78--
79--  Asterisk indicates arbitrary-length any text.
80--
81--  >>> sivMatch "( * )-( * ).k" `mapM` [ "foo.k", "foo-bar.k", "foo-baz.hs" ]
82--  Right [False,True,False]
83--
84-- === E3. ...
85--
86--  Three dots ellipsis indicates arbitrary-length any text.
87--  It is equivalent to asterisk.
88--
89--  >>> sivMatch "( ... )-( ... ).k" `mapM` [ "foo.k", "foo-bar.k", "foo-baz.hs" ]
90--  Right [False,True,False]
91--
92-- === E4. /Char-1/ - /Char-2/
93--
94--  Character range from /Char-1/ to /Char-2/.
95--
96--  >>> sivMatch "{- a-z -}{- 0-9 -}" `mapM` [ "foo1", "bar20", "baz" ]
97--  Right [True,True,False]
98--
99-- === E5. /Expr-1/ | /Expr-2/ | ... | /Expr-N/
100--
101--  One of /Expr-1/, /Expr-2/, ..., and /Expr-N/.
102--
103-- === E6. /Expr-1/ ? /Expr-2/
104--
105--  /Expr-1/ and /Expr-2/.
106--  __/Expr-1/ ? /Expr-2/ ? /Expr-3/__ equals to
107--  __( /Expr-1/ ? /Expr-2/ ) ? /Expr-3/__.
108--
109-- === E7. /Expr-1/ ! /Expr-2/
110--
111--  /Expr-1/ not /Expr-2/.
112--
113-- === E8. (= /Top/ =)
114--
115--  /Top/ is treated as top-level pattern.
116--
